so going back to why enterprises need aws organizations
so as a lot of workloads are moving on to the clouds organically you can see organizations
adding more and more aws accounts so centrally managing them and governing
them becomes a very top priority so aws organizations solves just this
problem because it offers policy based management and it offers them at a logical grouping
level which is also known as organizational unit or ou so
ou is a logical set of accounts which for example let's say if your organization has
strict compliance needs such as hipaa or pci all such accounts can be grouped under
one single ou and you can apply the policies that you want on that particular ou and the rest
of the accounts can go into separate one similarly if you are a
organization that is present globally you might have several production
accounts and you might want to tie all of those into one single garden
system so you might put all the production accounts into one ou and probably the rest staging and
development into others so that is uh overall what
aws organizations means and by using the management account the one
you see on the right hand side of the route in the diagram
you can organize your logical ous and apply individual policies
